Abstract: In the Victorian Era, â€œhysteriaâ€ù was a common diagnosis that often conï¬Åned women to bed for weeks on end. By placing severe limitations on women as a sex, the hysteria diagnosis reinforced Victorian social norms and helped to keep women intellectually, sexually, and socially subordinate to men.

Abstract: Molting, or the shedding of the epidermis, is crucial to insect growth and development. Abstract: The genre of poems about paintings, called ekphrasis, has fascinated poets from Homer to the present.
